You are given a regular polygon with $2n$ vertices (it's convex and has equal sides and equal angles) and all its sides have length 1.  

Your task is to find the smallest square that can contain this polygon.  The square must be large enough so that every point on or inside the polygon is also on or inside the square. You can rotate the polygon and/or the square.

**Input:**

* The first line contains a single integer $T$ ($1 \le T \le 200$) — the number of test cases.
* Each of the next $T$ lines contains a single odd integer $n$ ($3 \le n \le 199$).

**Output:**

* Print $T$ real numbers — one per test case. For each test case, print the minimum length of a side of the square.
You are given a polygon with an odd number of sides.  Find the smallest square that can fit this polygon inside it, where all corners of the polygon must be inside or on the edge of the square.
